Prompt Development Kit (Prompt Manager)

Cross‑platform Tauri + React desktop app to design, version, and orchestrate LLM prompt flows with reusable variables, code context aggregation, and a productivity‑oriented multi‑pane UI.

Problem

Building high‑quality LLM systems in a chat‑first workflow is hard to do repeatably. Prompts get scattered across threads, context is copied around by hand, and it’s difficult to track how variables, code snippets, and versions evolve over time. Teams need a local, fast, and structured way to author, organize, and re‑use prompts while pulling precise code context into sessions without brittle manual steps.

Approach

Prompt Manager is a cross‑platform desktop app (Tauri + Rust backend, React frontend) that treats prompt work like a proper build asset. It provides a visual flow editor for arranging prompts as nodes, a flexible variable system (global, flow‑scoped, code‑derived), robust versioning for flows and nodes, a productivity‑oriented multi‑pane UI with hotkeys, and a Code Context Builder that scans your repos to assemble curated context variables in Markdown, JSON, XML, or JSX formats.

Architecture

  • Rust + Tauri backend with rusqlite for durable storage and transactions.
  • React + TypeScript UI with Zustand stores and a recursive pane layout.
  • Graph editing via React Flow; drag, connect, and version nodes.
  • Event‑driven state updates using lightweight browser custom events.
  • Local persistence (SQLite for data, localStorage for UI prefs).
  • Parallel file scanning and caching in the Code Context Builder.

Stack

  • Tauri + Rust — Native desktop shell, plugins, and performant backend.
  • SQLite (rusqlite) — Simple, fast, transactional local DB.
  • React + Vite + TypeScript — Responsive, modular UI development.
  • Zustand — Compact global stores for panes and hotkeys.
  • React Flow — Visual flow/node canvas with edges and handles.
  • tiktoken_rs — Accurate token counts for nodes, flows, and ad‑hoc text.

Key Capabilities

  • Flows, nodes, and edges with drag‑and‑drop canvas editing.
  • Node editor with history, minor/major versioning, and rollback.
  • Variables: global, flow‑scoped, or references to other node fields.
  • Code Context Builder: profile‑based repo scans that emit curated context variables.
  • Hotkeys and multi‑pane layout for side‑by‑side authoring and review.
  • Tags, global search, duplication, import/export, and soft‑delete with undo.

Challenges

  • Consistency and safety — Solved with SQL transactions, soft‑delete ledger, and restore flows.
  • Context sprawl — Addressed via profile‑driven scans, caching, and format‑specific aggregators.
  • Complex layout UX — Managed by a recursive pane tree and event‑based hotkeys.

Outcomes

Prompt work becomes repeatable and auditable. Teams can assemble code context in minutes, copy fully merged node content with variable expansion, and keep iteration history without losing threads. The local, zero‑infrastructure footprint enables fast adoption on any machine while keeping data private.
